titleStmt.title: Good admonition. Or, Keep thy head on thy shoulders, and I will keepe mine. To the tune of, Merrily and cherrily, &c.

notesStmt.note: Text printed in four columns, each headed by a woodcut.
Satirical ballad refering to the Earl of Strafford, who was executed in May 1641, Sir John Finch and Sir Francis Windebank, who fled the country in the same year.
Copy mutilated, affecting illustration and slightly affecting text.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
